name: Disruptive Mood Dysregulation Disorder with Atypical Psychotic Features
chief_complaint: My child has extreme temper outbursts and says he sees shadow people when angry

lab_results.EEG: mild temporal lobe dysrhythmia during stress testing

treatment: Cognitive behavioral therapy with mood regulation focus
prognosis: Guarded - symptoms often persist into adulthood but may transform into different mood disorder presentations
description: A rare variant of DMDD where emotional dysregulation triggers brief psychotic-like symptoms without meeting criteria for schizophrenia spectrum disorders. Episodes typically last 30-90 minutes with complete reality testing between episodes.
risk_factors: Family history of bipolar spectrum disorders
